Editing Synthea Projects
  • Creating a Project
  • Page and Section Layout

Creating a Project

To create a new project, select File > New Project to bring up the Project Creation screen.

Project Name
The name of your project, which will appear in the title bar and project menu. Short and sweet works best.

Folder Name
Synthea needs to make a folder to store all your project files in. No special characters or anything fancy, just a few letters. You won't ever see this in Synthea but you can see the folder on your computer.

First Page
Every project needs one page to start with. You can always add more pages and/or change this page's name later.

Board Type
The board type makes creating cues faster by setting a default subgroup to new cues. You can always change a cue's subgroup later.

When you've filled out the above, click Create Project. Synthea will create the necessary files and folders for your new project and take you directly to editing.

Page and Section Layout

You can add pages and sections to your project layout by clicking on the + Add Page and + Add Section buttons. There is no limit to how many pages or sections a project can have... but be reasonable.

It is currently not possible to delete or re-order pages and sections, but that will come along soon.

Adding Media

In the bottom left, click on the add media icon (library_add) to open a file selection window. Select as many files as you want and click okay to add these files to the project.

NOTE: All files are copied to the project folder. Deleting this project will delete the copies, not the originals.

Editing Cues

Click on an existing cue button to edit it, or click on + Add Cue to create a new cue button.

Cue Title
The name of the cue, which will appear on the button and in the queue/playback track name.

Subgroup
If you assign this cue to a subgroup, when played it will fade out any other cues in the same subgroup. If this cue is playing and another cue in the same subgroup is played, this cue will fade out.

If you do not assign a subgroup, this cue will play on its own regardless of what else is playing.

Loop Cue
You can set this cue to loop by default. You can always change the loop state of a playing cue on the playback interface.

Fade In
By default, cues will either fade in or start at full volume, depending on the board's current setting. Instead, you can specify that this specific cue should always (or never) fade in.

Cue Audio File(s)
This area lists the audio files attached to the cue. You can remove an attached file by clicking on the removal icon (×), or attach a file using the Project Media section.

Project Media
Here you will see a list of all the media files in the project that can be attached to the cue. Select a file and click << Add File to Cue to attach it.

You can add new media files to the project by clicking on + Add Files.

NOTE: Any files added in this way will be automatically attached to the cue.

Delete Cue (delete)
You can click on the delete icon to remove a cue from the project. This will not affect any media files attached to the cue.
